title: TROLL FG
text:
Introduction
The general idea is to test TROLL 4.0’s ability to simulate the regional pattern of carbon balance (first test with gross primary production (GPP)) in French Guiana (Maréchaux et al. 2024; Schmitt et al. 2024). We will evaluate the spatial projections produced against regional patterns of forest structure derived from remote sensing, as well as point-wise forest inventories for forest dynamics and diversity, and single-point fluxes from an eddy tower. Further work could then explore the effect of future climates on the carbon balance.

title: TROLL FG
text:
Poeple

Sylvain Schmitt (sylvain.schmitt@cirad.fr)
Jérôme Chave (jerome.chave@univ-tlse3.fr)
Isabelle Maréchaux (isabelle.marechaux@inrae.fr)





Maréchaux, Isabelle, Fabian Jörg Fischer, Sylvain Schmitt, and Jérôme Chave. 2024. “TROLL 4.0: Representing Water and Carbon Fluxes, Leaf Phenology and Intraspecific Trait Variation in a Mixed-Species Individual-Based Forest Dynamics Model  Part 1: Model Description.” http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-3104.


Schmitt, Sylvain, Fabian Fischer, James Ball, Nicolas Barbier, Marion Boisseaux, Damien Bonal, Benoit Burban, et al. 2024. “TROLL 4.0: Representing Water and Carbon Fluxes, Leaf Phenology, and Intraspecific Trait Variation in a Mixed-Species Individual-Based Forest Dynamics Model  Part 2: Model Evaluation for Two Amazonian Sites.” http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-3106.

title: Study area
text: Summary. French Guiana undisturbed forest using TMF with a 10x10km grid.

title: French Guiana
text:
Administrative
You can download GADM data for French Guiana from https://gadm.org/download_country.html.


Code
fg <- st_read("data/raw_data/gadm41_GUF_shp/gadm41_GUF_0.shp",
              quiet = TRUE)
ggplot(fg) +
  geom_sf() +
  theme_bw()





Caption.

title: French Guiana
text:
Undisturbed forests
Based on TMF (Bourgoin et al. 2024)


Code
tmf <- file.path(
  "data",
  "raw_data",
  "JRC_TMF_UndisturbedDegradedForest_v1_1982_2024_SAM_ID49_N10_W60.tif"
  ) %>%
  rast() %>% 
  crop(fg) %>% 
  mask(fg)
tmf[tmf > 1] <- NA
tmf <- as.factor(tmf)
ggplot() +
  tidyterra::geom_spatraster(data = tmf) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = "lightgrey",
                    na.value = "transparent",
                    guide = "none") +
  theme_bw()





Caption.

title: French Guiana
text:
Guyafor & Guyaflux


Code
guyafor <- read_tsv("data/raw_data/guyafor.tsv") %>% 
  select(Forest, Plot, Xutm, Yutm) %>% 
  group_by(Forest, Plot) %>% 
  summarise_all(mean, na.rm = TRUE) %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  st_as_sf(coords = c("Xutm", "Yutm"), crs = 32622)
ggplot(fg) +
  geom_sf(fill = NA) +
  tidyterra::geom_spatraster(data = tmf) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = "lightgrey",
                    na.value = "transparent",
                    guide = "none") +
  geom_sf(data = guyafor, aes(col = Forest)) +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_color_discrete("Guyafor")





Caption.

title: French Guiana
text:
Test area
Starting from the biomass map of Fayad et al. (2016), we can compute a semi-variogram to help choose the resolution of interest. We can already see >50% variation above 10-km, but for test purposes we will test with >65% variation with a 20-km grid.


Code
agb <- rast("data/raw_data/fayad_2016/AGB_16122015.tif") %>% 
  scale()
agb_st <- as.data.frame(agb, xy = TRUE) %>% 
  st_as_sf(coords = c("x", "y"), crs = 32622)
t <- gstat::variogram(AGB_16122015~1, data = agb_st, cutoff = 50*10^3)
t %>% 
  ggplot(aes(dist/1000, gamma, size = np)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_bw() +
  xlab("Distance [ km ]") +
  ylab(("Varigroam estimate from scaled biomass")) +
  scale_size_continuous("# pairs") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 20, linetype = "dashed")





Caption.




We can select a small area with varying biomass based on Fayad et al. (2016) map. If we aim for a grid size of 20 km by 20 km, we can limit our test to a 400 simulations, covering an area of 20 x 20 = 400 km or approximatively 0.4°.


Code
agb <- rast("data/raw_data/fayad_2016/AGB_16122015.tif")
area <- tibble(lon = c(-52.7, -52.3), lat = c(4.0, 4.4)) %>% 
  st_as_sf(coords = c("lon", "lat"), crs = 4326) %>% 
  st_bbox() %>% 
  st_as_sfc()
ggplot(fg) +
  geom_sf(fill = NA) +
  tidyterra::geom_spatraster(data = agb) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(na.value = "transparent", guide = "none") +
  geom_sf(data = guyafor) +
  geom_sf(data = area, col = "red", fill = NA) +
  theme_bw()





Caption.






Code
ggplot(area) +
  geom_sf(fill = NA) +
  tidyterra::geom_spatraster(data = crop(agb, area %>% st_transform(crs = 32622))) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(na.value = "transparent", guide = "none") +
   geom_sf(data = st_intersection(area %>% st_transform(crs = 32622), guyafor)) +
  theme_bw()





Caption.








Bourgoin, C., G. Ceccherini, M. Girardello, C. Vancutsem, V. Avitabile, P. S. A. Beck, R. Beuchle, et al. 2024. “Human Degradation of Tropical Moist Forests Is Greater Than Previously Estimated.” Nature 631 (8021): 570–76. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-024-07629-0.


Fayad, Ibrahim, Nicolas Baghdadi, Stéphane Guitet, Jean-Stéphane Bailly, Bruno Hérault, Valéry Gond, Mahmoud El Hajj, and Dinh Ho Tong Minh. 2016. “Aboveground Biomass Mapping in French Guiana by Combining Remote Sensing, Forest Inventories and Environmental Data.” International Journal of Applied Earth Observation and Geoinformation 52 (October): 502–14. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jag.2016.07.015.

title: Grid
text:
We aim at using a 10 km by 10 km grid, but will first do a test with a 20 km by 20 km grid. We will first do a test with 400 simulations, covering an area of 20 x 20 = 400 km or approximatively 0.2°. We will use cell centre to define environment and simulate a representative 4-ha simulation. We can first represent the grid and evaluate expected biomass variation from Fayad et al. (2016) and soil and climate variation from input data (see in dedicated pages). The issue is that there is low biomass variation in the area in which to conduct the test. Perhaps we should use two areas.


Code
guyafor <- read_tsv("data/raw_data/guyafor.tsv") %>% 
  filter(Forest %in% c("Nouragues", "Montagne Tortue")) %>% 
  select(Forest, Plot, Xutm, Yutm) %>% 
  group_by(Forest, Plot) %>% 
  summarise_all(mean, na.rm = TRUE) %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  st_as_sf(coords = c("Xutm", "Yutm"), crs = 32622)
area <- tibble(lon = c(-52.7, -52.3), lat = c(4.0, 4.4)) %>% 
  st_as_sf(coords = c("lon", "lat"), crs = 4326) %>% 
  st_bbox() %>% 
  st_as_sfc()
grid <- st_make_grid(area, n = c(20, 20))
agb <- rast("data/raw_data/fayad_2016/AGB_16122015.tif") %>% 
  crop(area %>% st_transform(crs = 32622) %>% st_buffer(2*10^3))
ggplot(grid) +
  tidyterra::geom_spatraster(data = agb, alpha = .5) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(na.value = "transparent", guide = "none") +
  geom_sf(fill = NA) +
  geom_sf(data = guyafor) +
  theme_bw()





Caption.




The within cell variation in biomass was low with a median around 10 Mg/ha.


Code
extract(agb, vect(grid%>% st_transform(crs = 32622)), exact = TRUE) %>% 
  group_by(ID) %>% 
  mutate(delta = abs(AGB_16122015 - mean(AGB_16122015))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(delta)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  theme_bw() +
  xlab(expression('Cell'~Delta~AGB~"["~Mg~ha~"]"))





Caption.








Fayad, Ibrahim, Nicolas Baghdadi, Stéphane Guitet, Jean-Stéphane Bailly, Bruno Hérault, Valéry Gond, Mahmoud El Hajj, and Dinh Ho Tong Minh. 2016. “Aboveground Biomass Mapping in French Guiana by Combining Remote Sensing, Forest Inventories and Environmental Data.” International Journal of Applied Earth Observation and Geoinformation 52 (October): 502–14. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jag.2016.07.015.

title: Input data
text:
Summary. for a first test using Schmitt et al. (2024) species and global parameters, Muñoz-Sabater et al. (2021) ERA5-Land reanalysis, and METRADICA soil maps.





Muñoz-Sabater, Joaquín, Emanuel Dutra, Anna Agustí-Panareda, Clément Albergel, Gabriele Arduini, Gianpaolo Balsamo, Souhail Boussetta, et al. 2021. “ERA5-Land: A State-of-the-Art Global Reanalysis Dataset for Land Applications.” Earth System Science Data 13 (9): 4349–83. https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-13-4349-2021.


Schmitt, Sylvain, Fabian Fischer, James Ball, Nicolas Barbier, Marion Boisseaux, Damien Bonal, Benoit Burban, et al. 2024. “TROLL 4.0: Representing Water and Carbon Fluxes, Leaf Phenology, and Intraspecific Trait Variation in a Mixed-Species Individual-Based Forest Dynamics Model  Part 2: Model Evaluation for Two Amazonian Sites.” http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-3106.

title: Global
text:
For a first test, global parameters taken from Schmitt et al. (2024). Discuss limits and which parameter would deserve calibration/tuning.
We first used back parameters calibrated for Paracou from Schmitt et al. (2024) for a first test.


Code
rcontroll::generate_parameters(
  CR_a = 1.80,
  CR_b = 0.3860,
  m = 0.035,
  m1 = 0.035,
  pheno_a0 = 0.2,
  pheno_b0 = 0.015,
  pheno_delta = 0.1
) %>%
  filter(!(param %in% c(
    "nbiter", "HEIGHT", "length_dcell", "NV", "NH", "nbout", "nbspp",
    "DBH0", "H0", "CR_min", "CD0", "_SOIL_LAYER_WEIGHT",
    "_WATER_RETENTION_CURVE", "_LL_parameterization", "_LA_regulation",
    "_sapwood", "_seedsadditional", "_NONRANDOM", "Rseed",
    "_GPPcrown", "_BASICTREEFALL", "_SEEDTRADEOFF",
    "_CROWN_MM", "_OUTPUT_extended", "_OUTPUT_inventory",
    "extent_visual"
  ))) %>%
  knitr::kable()










param
value
description




cols
200.00000
/* nb of columns */


rows
200.00000
/* nb of rows */


SWtoPPFD
2.27000
/* convert short wave irradiance to PAR photons (cf. code) */


p_nonvert
0.05000
/* light incidence param (diff through turbid medium) */


klight
0.50000
/* light attenuation in the canopy Beer-Lambert */


phi
0.10625
/* quantum yield (in micromol C/micromol photon) */


absorptance_leaves
0.83000
/* absorptance of individual leaves */


theta
0.70000
/* parameter of the Farquhar model */


g1
3.77000
/* parameter g1 of Medlyn et al s stomatal conductance model */


g0
5.00000
/* minimum leaf conductance (mol m-2 s-1) */


pheno_a0
0.20000
/* threshold for change in old leaf shedding rate, in proportion of TLP */


pheno_b0
0.01500
/* threshold for change in old leaf shedding rate, in proportion of tree hieght */


pheno_delta
0.10000
/* amplitude of change in old leaf shedding rate */


vC
0.02100
/* variance of the flexion moment */


CR_a
1.80000
/* CR log intercept or Michaelis Menten initial growth */


CR_b
0.38600
/* CR log slope or Michaelis Menten asymptotic CR */


CD_a
0.00000
/* CD intercept (absolute value) */


CD_b
0.20000
/* CD slope (as fraction of tree height) */


shape_crown
0.72000
/* crown shape parameter */


dens
1.00000
/* initial leaf density (m2/m2) */


fallocwood
0.35000
/* fraction of biomass allocated to above ground wood (branch turnover+stem) */


falloccanopy
0.25000
/* fraction of biomass allocated to canopy (leaves + reproductive organs + twigs) */


Cseedrain
50000.00000
/* constant used to scale total seed rain per hectare across species (in next computation) */


nbs0
10.00000
/* nb of seeds produced and dispersed by each mature tree when SEEDTRADEOFF is not defined */


sigma_height
0.19000
/* intraspecific variation in tree height (lognormal) */


sigma_CR
0.29000
/* intraspecific variation in crown radius (lognormal) */


sigma_CD
0.00000
/* intraspecific variation in crown depth (lognormal) */


sigma_P
0.24000
/* intraspecific variation in leaf phosphorus (lognormal) */


sigma_N
0.12000
/* intraspecific variation in leaf nitrogen (lognormal) */


sigma_LMA
0.24000
/* intraspecific variation in LMA (lognormal) */


sigma_wsg
0.06000
/* intraspecific variation in wood specific gravity */


sigma_dbhmax
0.05000
/* intraspecific variation in maximum diameter */


sigma_leafarea
0.48000
/* intraspecific variation in leaf area (lognormal) */


sigma_tlp
0.10000
/* intraspecific variation in tlp (lognormal) */


corr_CR_height
0.00000
/* correlation coefficient between crown radius and tree height */


corr_N_P
0.65000
/* correlation coefficient between leaf nitrogen and leaf phosphorus */


corr_N_LMA
-0.43000
/* correlation coefficient between leaf nitrogen and LMA */


corr_P_LMA
-0.39000
/* correlation coefficient between leaf phosphorus and LMA */


leafdem_resolution
1.00000
/* resolution of leaf demography model */


p_tfsecondary
1.00000
/* probability of secondary treefall */


hurt_decay
0.00000
/* parameter determining how tree damages are repaired */


crown_gap_fraction
0.15000
/* fraction of gaps in the crown */


m
0.03500
/* minimal death rate */


m1
0.03500
/* m1 (slope of death rate) */


Cair
375.00000
/* atmospheric CO2 concentration in micromol/mol */


PRESS
101.00000
/* atmospheric pressure in kPa */









Schmitt, Sylvain, Fabian Fischer, James Ball, Nicolas Barbier, Marion Boisseaux, Damien Bonal, Benoit Burban, et al. 2024. “TROLL 4.0: Representing Water and Carbon Fluxes, Leaf Phenology, and Intraspecific Trait Variation in a Mixed-Species Individual-Based Forest Dynamics Model  Part 2: Model Evaluation for Two Amazonian Sites.” http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-3106.

title: Species
text:
For a first test, species parameters taken from Schmitt et al. (2024). Discuss limits and including more traits for more species such Vleminckx et al. (2021) or using Gentry ivnentories.


Code
data <- read_tsv("data/raw_data/Paracou_species_troll.tsv") %>% 
  select(-s_seedmass, -s_regionalfreq) %>% 
  rename_all(~ gsub("s_", "", .))
autoplot(
  princomp(select(data, -name), cor = TRUE),
  col = "lightgrey",
  loadings.label.size = 6,
  loadings.label.colour = "red", loadings.label.vjust = 1.1,
  loadings.label.repel = TRUE,
  loadings = TRUE, loadings.label = TRUE, loadings.colour = "red"
) +
  coord_equal() +
  geom_hline(aes(yintercept = 0), col = "black", linetype = "dotted") +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept = 0), col = "black", linetype = "dotted") +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")





Caption.








Schmitt, Sylvain, Fabian Fischer, James Ball, Nicolas Barbier, Marion Boisseaux, Damien Bonal, Benoit Burban, et al. 2024. “TROLL 4.0: Representing Water and Carbon Fluxes, Leaf Phenology, and Intraspecific Trait Variation in a Mixed-Species Individual-Based Forest Dynamics Model  Part 2: Model Evaluation for Two Amazonian Sites.” http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-3106.


Vleminckx, Jason, Claire Fortunel, Oscar Valverde-Barrantes, C. E. Timothy Paine, Julien Engel, Pascal Petronelli, Aurélie K. Dourdain, Juan Guevara, Solène Béroujon, and Christopher Baraloto. 2021. “Resolving Whole-Plant Economics from Leaf, Stem and Root Traits of 1467 Amazonian Tree Species.” Oikos 130 (7): 1193–1208. https://doi.org/10.1111/oik.08284.

text:
Summary. Muñoz-Sabater et al. (2021) ERA5-Land reanalysis.

title: Guyafor
text: To evaluate punctually forest structure and dynamics (eventually diversity).

title: Guyaflux
text:
To evaluate with a single point fluxes (maybe Schmitt et al. (2024) is enough).




Schmitt, Sylvain, Fabian Fischer, James Ball, Nicolas Barbier, Marion Boisseaux, Damien Bonal, Benoit Burban, et al. 2024. “TROLL 4.0: Representing Water and Carbon Fluxes, Leaf Phenology, and Intraspecific Trait Variation in a Mixed-Species Individual-Based Forest Dynamics Model  Part 2: Model Evaluation for Two Amazonian Sites.” http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-3106.

title: Dummy
text: Start with a 600-years spin-up in the subarea for a first test. Discuss how to summarise and aggregate raw outputs to save space.
